title: Dejan Lovren reveals how Jurgen Klopp kick-started his Anfield revolution
text:
Liverpool defender Dejan Lovren has revealed how Jurgen Klopp kick-started his Anfield revolution with an order to his players to clean up their act on and off the pitch.

Klopp celebrated the fourth anniversary of his appointment as Liverpool manager last weekend - when Tottenham Hotspur were his opponents - and Lovren marked the landmark by recalling the manager’s first message to his squad.

“He changed things in the club, from small details like saying. “Good morning” to everyone cleaning your table,” said Lovren. “I was raised to clean my table. He didn't have to tell me.

“I think some part of these details are missing in some clubs. It is about respect. When you have this outside of the pitch you will feel it also on the pitch. It is simple things.”

Liverpool face Spurs again on Sunday under vastly different circumstances to 2015 with Klopp’s side hoping to maintain their six-point lead over Manchester City.
